page.title: 02DOWN-ST-MARY VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Village Hall is on the edge of the green next to the church. It was built in 1860 and used to be a school containing about 40 pupils. The last headmistress was Miss Ball and the last infant teacher was Miss Kathy Andrews. Miss Ball came from Ilfracombe. She came by train to teach. When the school closed down in 1939 there were only three infants: Michael Quant, Pat Gun, and Phyliss Shobbrook; and the juniors were Johnny Harris, John Bolt, Philip Quant, Ian Quant, Alan Lear, Billy Tonkins and Madeline Tout. The infants went to Bow School and the juniors to North Tawton. It is now just a Village Hall used for many activities, including the Youth Club and Women's Institute.
